channel.title: Write Up on Alan's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Write Up on Alan's Blog

item.title: Microcorruption Writeup
item.description: New Orleans - 10pts Here is the code for checking the password: 44bc: 0e43 clr r14 44be: 0d4f mov r15, r13 44c0: 0d5e add r14, r13 44c2: ee9d 0024 cmp.b @r13, 0x2400(r14) 44c6: 0520 jne #0x44d2 <check_password+0x16> 44c8: 1e53 inc r14 44ca: 3e92 cmp #0x8, r14 44cc: f823 jne #0x44be <check_password+0x2> 44ce: 1f43 mov #0x1, r15 44d0: 3041 ret 44d2: 0f43 clr r15 44d4: 3041 ret It basically takes each byte and perform cmp.

item.title: Crossctf Qualifier 2018 Writeup
item.description: QuirkyScript 1 Problem var flag = require("./flag.js"); var express = require('express') var app = express() app.get('/flag', function (req, res) { if (req.query.first) { if (req.query.first.length == 8 && req.query.first == ",,,,,,," ) { res.send(flag.flag); return; } } res.send("Try to solve this."); }); app.listen(31337) Solution According to the express.js docs, req.query.* can be an array. Also, the code used == instead of ===; therefore, values of different types can be equal to each other and types are converted according to this:
